title: Hyperbolic cluster mapping — hyperbolize
text: D Numeric matrix, observations rows variables columns. numk Integer. Number clusters. preprocess Either character string specifying clustering method ("kmeansWrap", "kmeans", "kmedians", "hddc", "pgmm"), directly clustering result / label vector: scale Character. Scaling choice data: "std": standardize using scale(D). "norm": center rescale fixed average norm (paper sec 3.2). use_input_order Logical. title: Hyperbolic cluster mapping with multiple anchors — hyperbolizeEV
code: hyperbolizeEV(   D,   numk,   preprocess,   scale = c("std", "norm"),   local_model = "kmeansWrap",   kg_per_class = 5,   lambda = 1e-06,   spread_scale = 1,   use_input_order = F )

title: Hyperbolic cluster mapping with multiple anchors — hyperbolizeEV
text: D Numeric matrix, observations rows variables columns. numk Integer. Number clusters. preprocess Either character string specifying clustering method ("kmeansWrap", "kmeans", "kmedians", "hddc", "pgmm"), directly clustering result / label vector: scale Character. Scaling choice data: "std": standardize using scale(D). "norm": center rescale fixed average norm (paper sec 3.2). local_model Character. Clustering model used define local sub-centers within global cluster (e.g. "kmeansWrap"). kg_per_class Integer. Number local sub-centers per cluster. lambda Numeric. Ridge parameter used local projection step. spread_scale Numeric. Controls far local sub-centers spread global centroid tangent plane (corresponds \(\delta\) paper). use_input_order Logical. FALSE (default), cluster centers reordered using order_clusters_tsp. TRUE, input cluster order kept.

title: Hyperbolic cluster mapping with multiple anchors — hyperbolizeEV
text: list components: points n × 2 matrix. Final 2D hyperbolic embedding samples. centers numk × 2 matrix. 2D positions cluster centroids. cluster Integer vector length n. Cluster label sample. analysis Model fit object returned chosen clustering method    , NULL cluster labels supplied directly. local_info List length numk. global cluster \(g\)     contains local mapping objects: indices observations, centroid     original space tangent space, fitted local sub-centers, 2D     coordinates, tangent-plane disk embeddings samples. params List main tuning parameters used call.

title: Hyperbolic cluster mapping with multiple anchors — hyperbolizeEV
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Iris demo set.seed(42) out <- hyperbolizeEV(   iris[, 1:4],   numk       = 3,   preprocess = "kmeansWrap",   scale      = "std" ) plot_disk(out, 3)  ## Yale faces demo (from PPCI) if (!requireNamespace("PPCI", quietly = TRUE)) {   message("Package 'PPCI' is not installed") } else {   set.seed(42)   library(PPCI)   out <- hyperbolizeEV(     PPCI::yale$x,     numk         = 10,     preprocess   = PPCI::yale$c,     scale        = "norm",     local_model  = "kmeansWrap",     kg_per_class = 10,     spread_scale = 0.6   )   plot_disk(out, 10) } } # }
